title: Large-Scale Educational Design for International Virtual Exchange Programs: Autoethnography-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of online learning and basic intercultural communication
context.additional_context: Strengthening educational design competencies for multicultural environments in response to post-COVID-19 needs for expanded non-face-to-face international exchanges

learning_goals: Learners can complete PBL projects in collaboration with multicultural team members.

Using autoethnographic techniques (participant observation, in-depth interviews, field notes), learners select 3 cross-cultural education cases (e.g., multicultural classrooms, international workshops, online collaboration projects) and write a 1,500-character reflective report analyzing 2 learning effects/limitations per case based on cultural context. The report must score ≥4 points (out of 5) in ≥2 of 3 rubric criteria (analytical depth, cultural context reflection, logical consistency).
Learners conduct at least three international collaborative workshops using online collaboration tools (e.g., Zoom, Padlet).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
